text: @exesilasa why do I have to call them by their prefered pronouns to show basic decency? Why do I have a moral obligation to use a certain set of words to refer to that person?

@exesilasa but that’s the point, everything will become normalized so where would it end? If a human wanted to identify as a dog, why wouldn’t that be acceptable? If a 60 year old white male “felt” like a 25 year old black woman, would he be deemed “normal?” The whole point is where would we as a society draw a line? Everyone is more focused on protecting each other’s feelings when in reality the bigger problem is being annoyed.

@exesilasa because then what's the practical purpose for calling somebody by their prefered pronouns? The fact that they want to be referred to by a certain set of pronouns is not a good enough reason as to why me or other people shoild refer to them by those pronouns.

@pjfitz193 what's your definition of the word "transgender"? Somebody who identifies as a certain gender or somebody who had a transition? Because I would define it as the latter. The word "transgender" was used to describe somebody who had a sex-change surgery. That was, before the far-left gender ideologues changed the definition of that word to suit their ideology. As well as the words gender and queer.
Well transgenders are mentally ill but society rather value feelings over facts..pretty soon pedophiles are going to be accepted the way the left is going.
